parts.text: Go to https://github.com/priyank766/Different-Types_of_RAG and scroll down to print the shoutouts given
Okay, I'll navigate to the GitHub repository, find the "Shoutouts" section, and print the shoutouts. First, I'll navigate to the page.

config.system_instruction:
You are a helpful web browsing assistant that can interact with websites using playwright.
                    - Navigate to websites and perform browser actions (click, scroll, type)
                    - Extract information from web pages 
                    - Take screenshots of page elements when useful
                    - Provide concise summaries of web content using markdown
                    - Follow multi-step browsing sequences to complete tasks
                    
                Respond back with a status update on completing the commands.

parts.text: Okay, I'll navigate to the GitHub repository, find the "Shoutouts" section, and print the shoutouts. First, I'll navigate to the page.

content.text:
### Ran Playwright code
```js
await page.goto('https://github.com/priyank766/Different-Types_of_RAG');
```

### Page state
- Page URL: https://github.com/priyank766/Different-Types_of_RAG
- Page Title: GitHub - priyank766/Different-Types_of_RAG: This project implements a Streamlit application that allows users to interact with a PDF knowledge base using different Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques.
- Page Snapshot:

                - button "Outline" [ref=e333] [cursor=pointer]:
                  - img [ref=e334]
              - article [ref=e337]:
                - generic [ref=e338]:
                  - heading "Different Types of RAG" [level=1] [ref=e339]
                  - 'link "Permalink: Different Types of RAG" [ref=e340] [cursor=pointer]':
                    - /url: "#different-types-of-rag"
                    - img [ref=e341]
                - paragraph [ref=e343]: This project implements a Streamlit application that allows users to interact with a PDF knowledge base using different Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques.
                - generic [ref=e344]:
                  - heading "Features" [level=2] [ref=e345]
                  - 'link "Permalink: Features" [ref=e346] [cursor=pointer]':
                    - /url: "#features"
                    - img [ref=e347]
                - list [ref=e349]:
                  - listitem [ref=e350]:
                    - strong [ref=e351]: "Multiple RAG Strategies:"
                    - text: "Explore and compare different RAG behaviors:"
                    - list [ref=e352]:
                      - listitem [ref=e353]:
                        - strong [ref=e354]: "Corrective RAG:"
                        - text: Runs multiple passes where the LLM validates its generated answer against retrieved documents. If contradictions or unsupported claims are found, it attempts to correct or refine the answer. Great for enhancing factual precision and reducing hallucinations.
                      - listitem [ref=e355]:
                        - strong [ref=e356]: "Agentic RAG:"
                        - text: Uses the LLM as an agent capable of planning, reasoning, and calling external tools (like a retriever) based on the query. Best for multi-step logic, dynamic decisions, and sophisticated problem-solving.
                      - listitem [ref=e357]:
                        - strong [ref=e358]: "Adaptive RAG:"
                        - text: Adapts its retrieval strategy or answer generation based on factors like chat history, user preferences, or the perceived complexity/type of the query. Useful for providing more personalized and context-aware answers.
                      - listitem [ref=e359]:
                        - strong [ref=e360]: "Hybrid RAG:"
                        - text: Combines adaptiveness, validation, and agentic tool use for complex workflows. It can dynamically switch between strategies, offering a robust and flexible solution for diverse information retrieval tasks.
                  - listitem [ref=e361]:
                    - strong [ref=e362]: "Flexible Knowledge Base:"
                    - text: Use the default PDFs or upload your own.
                  - listitem [ref=e363]:
                    - strong [ref=e364]: "Easy to Use:"
                    - text: Simple Streamlit interface for interacting with the RAG system.
                - generic [ref=e365]:
                  - heading "Getting Started" [level=2] [ref=e366]
                  - 'link "Permalink: Getting Started" [ref=e367] [cursor=pointer]':
                    - /url: "#getting-started"
